main event: Three observers reported seeing a white object that changed shape and then vanished in Matawan, New Jersey on December 1, 1958.
interesting points: The object initially appeared to be a jet trail, inclined at 60 degrees to the horizon.
The object then changed to a level position, seemed to 'burn' and form a small white brilliant dot, before vanishing.
The object was under observation for about 2 minutes.
The observers were three engineers employed by the Industrial Washing Machine Corp in Matawan.
The Air Force requested the observers complete a questionnaire for further analysis.
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
